data.title: The climate of Brazil and the best time to visit
data.meta_description: Discover the climate of Brazil. Read about average temperatures, rainfall, and the ideal months to visit.
data.text:
What’s the climate like in Brazil?

The current climate in Brazil features temperatures ranging from a high of 36°C to a low of 29°C throughout the year. The average yearly temperature is around 32°C. At night, temperatures in the colder months average around 15°C and in the warmer months around 22°C.

The highest temperature recorded in Brazil in recent years was 43°C in October 2014. The lowest daytime temperature recorded was 19°C in October 2017.

On average, Brazil receives 1607 mm of rainfall each year. For comparison, United Kingdom gets 862 mm of rainfall annually.

Jan Feb Mar Apr May Jun Jul Aug Sep Oct Nov Dec Temp. max (°C) 29 29 31 29 32 33 31 36 32 34 32 30 Rainfall Rainfall (mm) 397 244 185 108 11 0,5 0,6 4,8 64 106 213 273

Click on the month name to see more weather details, like daily averages, temperatures, and precipitation for the past years in that month.

The best time to visit Brazil for sunny weather is April through July, September and October. During this period, you'll have good temperatures and not too much rain, making it a great time to visit Brazil. In the other months of the year, there's too much rain or the temperature isn't ideal for a visit if you want sunny and pleasant weather.

Climate Table of Brazil

The climate table of Brazil shows the average temperatures, rainfall, and UV index per month. The table gives an overview of the average day and night temperatures in degrees Celsius, the total amount of rainfall in millimetres, the total snowfall in centimetres, and the UV index for each month. Rainfall is always measured as water, even if it's snow or hail.

Jan Feb Mar Apr May Jun Jul Aug Sep Oct Nov Dec Temp. max (°C) 29 29 31 29 32 33 31 36 32 34 32 30 Temp. min (°C) 21 20 22 19 20 19 16 20 16 21 21 21 Rainfall Rainfall (mm) 397 244 185 108 11 0,5 0,6 4,8 64 106 213 273 UV Index 7 8 8 8 8 7 8 8 9 9 8 8

Click on the month name to see more weather details, like daily averages, temperatures, and precipitation for the past years in that month.

Average yearly temperature: 32°C

Highest temperature: 36°C in August

Lowest temperature: 29°C in January, February and April

Precipitation: 1607 mm per year, averaging 134 mm per month

Driest months: 0,5 mm in June, 0,6 mm in July and 4,8 mm in August

Wettest months: 397 mm in January, 273 mm in December and 244 mm in February

Average Temperature per Month in Brazil

This graph shows the average maximum temperatures per month in Brazil. The temperatures are shown in degrees Celsius and the average is calculated based on the recorded temperatures per month from past years.

Average Rainfall per Month in Brazil

This graph shows how much rainfall Brazil gets on average per month. Rainfall is always measured as water, even if it's snow or hail. This makes it easy to compare how much has fallen, regardless of the form of precipitation. The amount of rainfall is measured in millimetres and the average is calculated based on the recorded rainfall per month from past years.

Average UV Index per Month in Brazil

This graph shows the average UV index per month in Brazil. The UV index indicates the intensity of ultraviolet radiation and ranges from 0 to a maximum of 11.

Yearly Temperature in Brazil

This graph shows the average yearly temperature in Brazil. The yearly temperature, expressed in degrees Celsius, is the average of all twelve monthly temperatures summed up for that year.

Total Yearly Rainfall in Brazil

This chart shows the total yearly rainfall in Brazil over the past few years. The total yearly rainfall, measured in centimetres, is the sum of all the rain that fell in the twelve months of that year.
